website_summaries.verdict: A soft, reclaimed pulp bedding that is safe for a variety of pets.
pros: This paper-based bedding uses recycled paper materials to ensure that your pet's home is cozy and safe
Far more absorbent than shavings and splinter-free to protect animals
This bedding does a decent job of suppressing odors
cons: A few customers reported wood chips mixed into the bedding

customer_reviews.title: BAD smell, not the same as the original
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased this exact product on here and elsewhere and I know what it smells like. It has a slight smell, but it never smelled bad. The last 2 times I received this bedding from this seller the smell was so bad I could smell it through the package. It smelled sour and rotten like vinegar. When I put it in my piggies cage it smelled the whole room up and I had to throw it out. The smell lingered even after throwing it away! Don’t waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: I'm a rat breeder, just wow!
customer_reviews.text: I normally change my bedding every Weds, last week I got this.. And there was a DRAMATIC difference in odor control. Even the buddy who is boarding them told me there's no stink after 6 days. When I went to check each tub, so much cleaner, no ammonia smell, and I had no mess issues or sneezing issues. It's taken me 4 months to find the ultimate bedding.. This will be a continuous buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lyss

customer_reviews.title: this is a pretty large bag
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery!! Same product and affordable.. cheaper than Petco! Thank you. Btw, this is a pretty large bag.
customer_reviews.author: Viva

customer_reviews.title: Closer to grey in color, the better it is.
customer_reviews.text: Claim of odor control is BS. Its paper that absorbs liquid and nothing else. If the liquid stinks, such as urine, it still smells like urine. I've been through a lest 30 60L bags with two rabbits that are litter box trained, and this stuff is hit and miss. If you get it, and it is grey, then it will absorb like a sponge. If it is light brown, then it absorbs, but may still leave wetness on the bottom of the litter box. If it is a darker brown, it is completely useless. It will not absorb most of the liquid.
customer_reviews.author: Sandman

customer_reviews.title: RANDOM THINGS FOUND INSIDE BAG
customer_reviews.text: I always got this brand for my chinny. Everything was all good for me except the dust, but I didnt complain. This is my first time buying from the seller. Found little ROCKS and wtf is this thing? :/
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All though I do appreciate this arriving early and being ...
customer_reviews.text: All though I do appreciate this arriving early and being cheap, I do not appreciate that I wasn't told the whole truth about what I purchased. It is labeled as 50L, one would think they are purchasing a 50L bag but you are not. Its the 25L bags that "double in size to 50L". I think you should re-label this correctly so others dont make the same assumptions i did. The only place it says its 25L is in the picture and even then you have to zoom in on it and hope you can read it. Please fix the listing description.
customer_reviews.author: Don Adams

customer_reviews.title: MUCH less than the usual 60L pack.
customer_reviews.text: Suddenly, there is a scarcity of pet bedding. Have you noticed? After ten years of ordering 60L packs, for $14, delivered via Prime, suddenly there are none to be had. So, ordered these BS little packs instead. They contain hardly any fluff. Get about 1.5 week's worth out of them. I feel like Amazon is trying to artificially hike the prices of this product. Like the tulip bulbs of yore. Lame.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Elise

customer_reviews.title: What is the non blue material in there?
customer_reviews.text: For some reason there are big chunks of something fluffy (not bedding) throughout my whole bag of carefresh. What is it? Cannot use it in case my guinea pigs ingest this.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Beware...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible smelling!! Been using this for years and the company must have changed to darker cheaper material. It has wood chips mixed in and smells like sewer! So disgusting!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: it smelled horrible and it included clumpy dust like powdery pieces that ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been a loyal customer of the Carefresh pet bedding. Until today. The last time i received it, it smelled horrible and it included clumpy dust like powdery pieces that you would normally find in the inside of a vacuum cleaner. This has never happened before and i am shocked at the poor quality of this product. I am worried for the safety of my guinea pigs as it smells extremely bad and i'm afraid it might be toxic for them. I gave the product one star because i couldn't rate it with none. Be very careful when ordering this product and read the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Towsief Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: It is so much easier to have this delivered by Amazon than stuffing it in your cart etc at the store. The litter spells great, it does a great job absorbing fluids and feces of the pets (we use them for our indoor rabbits and a hedgehog), and this type of bedding naturally repels fleas. And even better, the price on Amazon is cheaper than Walmart. With good quality bedding, we don't have to change the litter but once a week with the rabbit, and once every 2 or more weeks with the hedgehog. It absorbs the odor and the animals seem comfortable and at ease.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Atgood

customer_reviews.title: Horrible smell and it’s supposed to be unscented!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this originally in PetSmart for our hamster, so when I saw it was for a better deal on here, I got it. Well, I must have gotten a defective pack because it absolutely stinks...smells like wet dirty socks and it’s a darker color compared to what we got at PetSmart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Addict

customer_reviews.title: First timer, read all !
customer_reviews.text: False advertising. It's not 23L it's 12L that expands to 23L. Good for the price, this size in the pet store is 18 bucks but here it's 10. A nice saving. Also a little goes a long way. So far so good for my first time. I recommend and will be buying from here for now on!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Arguello

customer_reviews.title: I liked this stuff in the past
customer_reviews.text: I liked this stuff in the past!! I re ordered this from amazon again and my pet mouse had an allergic reaction to it! I had to go to the vet for this because I thought she had mites or something. Turns out she is just allergic to this bag of bedding for some reason! WILL NOT REPURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Paxton

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed this product for the last 6 months, but the last batch was just awful. The pieces were big and hard. It was like pouring rocks into my hedgehogs bin. I did not appreciate the change in the bedding or the neglect in quality control of this Carefresh product. Makes me worried about ordering this product again. Will it be the soft and colorful product I came to expect or will it be a sub-par product that I will be stuck using??? I don't think I'll take that risk. Sorry not sorry, Carefresh. You lost a customer.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty Werbenjagermanjensen

customer_reviews.title: Hard pellets, smells bad
customer_reviews.text: Pictured: bedding from this bag on the left, bedding my last bag on the right I always buy this brand, but this bag was horrible. It’s usually super soft and fluffy with no smell at all. This bag smells like Elmer’s glue and the paper is packed into hard lumps. I tried washing a handfull in the sink, and the smell was gone instantly, but I couldn’t achieve the same fluffy texture as my previous bag. Whatever had been mixed in is water soluble. Will continue to experiment with this batch, ordering another bag in the meantime. Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Shaelynn Romero

customer_reviews.title: Best bedding for small mammals
customer_reviews.text: Carefresh is the best bedding for small mammals in my opinion. I use it for my rats and guinea pigs. It does not have dust which is harmful for their respiratory systems and it is super easy to clean. I just a litter box scooper and it works well. Stays smelling fresh for a long time. It is also soft and comfortable for my pets to sleep in. The only reason I am putting 4 stars instead of 5 is because the product I received is not the same color as the picture (size is correct though). This is not a big deal as it still looks nice and does the job but thought it was worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Glassley

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Anyone who cares for their guinea pig(s) needs to avoid this bedding.
customer_reviews.text: Guinea pigs are eating/ingesting this bedding, which is causing a serious bout of intestinal blockage and making them feel full without a single drop of nutrition in their stomachs. Over time, this causes bloat and eventually death. I was never someone who felt fleece bedding was as important as it is now. After using and depending on Carefresh for many years, i will never purchase another bag of it again and am currently making the switch after seeing my piggie eat this stuff like it was oatmeal. I don't know if she will pass it, now or ever, but had to take immediate action for the sake of her well-being.
customer_reviews.author: Hypergeek

customer_reviews.title: Horrible smell
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this for the past few months. Our last purchase of it was at the end of November. Both bags that we purchased, when opened, smelled horrible! They smell rotten, like sewage. Not a pleasant smell at all. We didn't use it and are sending them back. I'm not sure what happened, as this is the first time but yuck! I would not put it in my animals cage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware of fur mites
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this bedding for a long time for my daughter’s pet mice, because my daughter loves how colorful it is. But then her mice, who’ve lived together in that same cage for 2 years, developed a nasty case of fur mites. Imagine mice that look like zombies: that’s what fur mites do. Fur mites are incredibly difficult to clear up in mice. And it turns out fur mites can come in contaminated paper bedding! So this bedding looks nice and is great for absorbency and smell, but we switched to pine shavings to avoid any future contamination.
customer_reviews.author: teamnasty

customer_reviews.title: A good option for older pets
customer_reviews.text: This bedding is definitely better on odor control than other bedding. We switched from the natural to the white with our rats because they were aging and we were able to see if there were health issues easier. This change actually saved the life of one of our rats because we could detect an issue right away and got her the treatment that she needed the next day. The natural brown bedding would have hid the fact that she was ill.
customer_reviews.author: V.C.

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend for mice or rats
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this for my mice, but it was so dusty that it made both me and them sneeze. I have since switched them to Kaytee Clean & Cozy, which is virtually dust-free and does not bother any of our allergies. My mice also seem to much prefer the Kaytee Clean & Cozy for burrowing. While I wouldn't recommend this bedding for mice or rats, I will say that the odor control was quite good... That's the only thing I miss about it.
customer_reviews.author: Ky

customer_reviews.title: Tiny bag. Misleading description.
customer_reviews.text: I suppose it’s my own fault for not zooming in on the photo, but this bag isn’t even enough to fill the cage once. The description says 14L, but in reality it is only 6 and expands to 14. I could have bought a way bigger bag for a few dollars more, but I thought I was getting 14L, not 6. I’m over amazon and the misleading descriptions and their failure to deliver on time lately. The cost for Orine is ridiculous and they fail on most of the services. The photo I took is the bag next to a regular size tv remote.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for 15$ here on Amazon compared to other large chain pet stores. The color is very vibrant and looks great, my hamster loves the softness too. About 1/5 of the bag covered the entire floor to a critter nation.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Was a great product, but new bags smell BAD when opened
customer_reviews.text: This WAS my go-to brand for our Syrian hamsters for the last two years. It WAS great stuff. Buuuut...the latest batch smelled like fertilizer when we opened it (seriously- I was looking for dog poop nearby because the smell was so bad and I was confused! How could that smell be the bedding????)! I see in the reviews that others are experiencing similar odor issues with brand new bags of this stuff. It’s list my trust - I just ordered a different brand to try.
customer_reviews.author: Shearon M.

customer_reviews.title: Made my hamster sick
customer_reviews.text: This bedding gave my hamster an upper respiratory infection, which I had to take him to the vet for. He is better now after 10 days of antibiotics but I will NOT buy this again. It is very dusty and also has a weird rotting cheese smell to it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyanne R.

customer_reviews.title: Crappy material doesn’t work anymore
customer_reviews.text: So this stuff used to be amazing. I used to get a big 60L bag of this and it worked awesome for my hedge. Somewhere along the line they stopped selling that and it got substituted for this. It doesn’t wick away scent anymore and it’s not fluffy like it used to be. My hedgehog used to love burrowing in the fluff and now he just goes under his blanket. Do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Grace H.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Wasted Your Money - Product Quality Has Changed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product several times in the past for my indoor rabbit. I was very pleased because the pieces are larger which makes it more difficult for my rabbit to sling out of his cage and onto my floor. The last bag that I purchased had a very strong odor / smell, almost like vinegar. I used it anyway and now my rabbit is very sick. He doesn't want to eat and stays on the upper level of his cage, away from the bedding. I don't know why the quality of this product has changed so drastically but now I am trying to find a new bedding. I will not purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: 24Lang

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Very Large
customer_reviews.text: The product is awesome and as advertised virtually dust free which is so important for small animals and their respiratory systems. This is the first time I have purchased this and because almost all sellers use a cubic inch description for size, I want anyone to know that it is very very large. For frame of reference it's about the size of a 15-20 pound bag of cat or dog food and weighs that much too. Because it's so compressed you really get your money's worth. Would absolutely buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnny

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic colored bedding at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute with a variety of bright colors! I bought this to liven up my cage & it did the job wonderfully. It immediately began to puff up and out as I pulled it out of the package and spread it apart in my nesting bin. It’s a little bit tougher than most paper beddings that I’ve used in my girl’s cage but it’s also 4 times as more absorbent so I don’t mind it and neither does my mouse. A little bit goes a long way so it lasts quite a while. Totally recommend this bedding!
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Different
customer_reviews.text: This product used to be my go to, however it has changed. The pieces don't feel like just paper anymore and have a weird texture. It also smells funky. I'm worried about the safety of what is made of now. Going to look for a different brand from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The people that say it's not 23 liters.
customer_reviews.text: This is great soft bedding and a good deal. Nice to have it arrive at the front door. As for the amount you get, which made me wonder if it was in fact false advertising. The package does say 12.3 liters, but it EXPANDS to 23 liters. It's compressed. I am fine with and prefer a smaller bag that expands. It fluffs out nice. If it wasn't compressed it would fill a 23 liter bag.
customer_reviews.author: L. D.

customer_reviews.title: Warning!
customer_reviews.text: I would give a zero if I could because this bedding killed our hamster. My daughter is devastated. This is a warning be careful when buying for an amazon, you never know what you are actually purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly McIrvin

customer_reviews.title: New package - horrible smells- smells up whole room like sour vomit
customer_reviews.text: Used this product for years for my guinea pigs. Never had any problems. Now there's new packaging and I don't know if the formula has change or what but it smells horrible. As soon as I opened the package I knew something wasn't right. I ordered another 3 packages and it was the same thing. When I put it in their cage It smells up my whole room like sour vomit. I will be switching to oxbow or small pet select bedding from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: This bedding killed two of our pets
customer_reviews.text: I went through an entire economy sized pack of carefresh (multi colored bedding) pack of this bedding for our dwarf hamster, a robo, over the course of two years. After receiving this blue pack my son's beloved pet curled up in a ball and died. We thought it might be old age but then bought a baby, cleaned the cage and started over and she died too. Won't be using anymore of this bedding, something is wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: crystal

customer_reviews.title: Hardest "fluff" on earth
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like such a good deal for the price but the bedding was hard even after fluffing it up. I feel bad putting it in my hamsters cage and definetly wont be buying it again but he doesnt seem too bothered by it. I usually get white bedding so I can see where he peed so I also dont like this too much since it made spot cleaning harder. It definetly lasts a while though... just wish it was softer. I mixed it with kaytee clean and cozy and that made it easy for my hamster to burrow in it so thats the only reason i keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: ♡ Rose ♡

customer_reviews.title: inconsistent quality
customer_reviews.text: Using this product for several years, It is very inconsistent with the quality, I was getting this through the subscribe and save program, and instead of getting the large bag, I suddenly start getting 4 small bags. This is when I noticed that the texture of the paper got lighter and thin, and its odor control reduced drastically. This item smells like acid only few days after cleaning up the whole cage (1 Guinea pig only) Needless to say, I am NOT getting this anymore. I hope the company will consider changing back to what this product used to be - when it got all the stars for it's lost quality,
customer_reviews.author: Gluestick

customer_reviews.title: Great product overall
customer_reviews.text: This bedding has been wonderful for our rats, who don’t have any particular organization to their bathroom habits. It helped with the smell a ton. However, I don’t recommend this for longer haired rabbits. It gets tangled up and solidifies in his fur by his bottom and causes all sorts of problems for the poor guy. I’ll stick with pellet bedding for him.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was a little fluffier but does the job
customer_reviews.text: Giving this a try to help curb odor and so far is doing the job. I got a hamster about a month ago in the fluffing that came with the cage was nice and fluffy and my hamster loved it but it didn’t take long to smell horrible. With this stuff it’s been about 10 days and no odor. You also don’t need to use a ton so the bag should last a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Cadengo

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but small amount
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product but the packages are like so small. The size of each package is enough for a hamster cage . I actually bought these for my two big bunnies who have a big litter box lol. Had to use two packs instead of one for the litter box. But they do love it. Its soft. My bunnies love soft litter and they thump and scratch at hard litter lol Again the quality is great but the packages are pretty small. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Taniaess1

customer_reviews.title: The smell was just horrible
customer_reviews.text: All I can say about this product is that it smelled horrible. I tried working with it and still using it, but with 1/3 left I couldn’t anymore and decided to switch to aspen shavings. I just couldn’t stand the smell, I couldn’t tell the absorbency because even after a day of having it in there it smelled even worse, I’m sure my babies didn’t enjoy it either. I wouldn’t buy again, I’m sorry but I’ll stick to aspen shavings now.
customer_reviews.author: Aylin Castellanos

customer_reviews.title: Horrible odor in recent order
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this product for 1+ year for our Guinea pigs, works great in their litter pans, absorbant and nice texture. The last 2 bags we purchased had a foul odor however. I will switch to another brand. The clean shavings straight out of the bag really stink like garbage.
customer_reviews.author: T. McNamara

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, but I wish the bedding wasn't so thick
customer_reviews.text: The bedding is okay. I personally wish that the bedding was shredded more fine to make is easier for my hamster to burrow. It's also hard to spot clean it with the pieces being so chunky and the little seeds and poop falling through the cracks. It's also not that soft. I've only used this stuff for the past 2 weeks and already ready to replace the entire bedding. Maybe this type of bedding is better for larger animals like guinea pigs and rabbits. I also ordered the "Natural" color and received "White". I'll be trying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Susan J

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my feeder mice cage and I have used this same bedding previously when I had pet rats. I have my mouse cage on my bedside table and have not noticed any smells while using this bedding, so it's very absorbent and holds in any odors. It does what is supposed to do. My only complaint would be that I wish the packaging had a ziploc seal because I always end up spilling a little bit of it when I am done using it. This issue isn't big enough to change my rating though. The price is great and so is the product.
customer_reviews.author: TammyC117

customer_reviews.title: Soft and confortable for my hamster
customer_reviews.text: Really big bag for a awesome price, I put this in my hamster cage in top of some Kaytee soft granule and my hamster really like it he comes and go grabbing some of the bedding to his little house, that is something he didn't do before with the aspen bedding, is more active now instead of just sleeping all day, maybe because this bedding is more comfortable for him to walk on? Im happy that he is more active, I think I have enough for a least 6 months maybe more , thanks for this wonderful product, I recommend this 100%
customer_reviews.author: Aby_stars2016

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't a fan of this stuff. Kids each have a guinea pig (2) and we initially bought this to try and keep the odor down, didn't really help (changing once a week). work well with keeping everything together but as far as scent and "Fresh", not so much. Good stuff if your not looking for a scent masking type of bedding. on the other hand it was certainly enough to change bedding once a week for a few weeks before we had to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: nic

customer_reviews.title: "New Odor Stop" Carefresh Complete is now rough and scratchy.
customer_reviews.text: The bags purchased from Amazon for the past few years have had soft bedding (as has been the many years purchased from retail stores). Just opened a new bag and discovered that the softness has been removed and it is now rough and scratchy! . This change is so frustrating. I may have to switch to a different brand. Why do companies have to tinker with their product when they already have had a winner for years!
customer_reviews.author: Butterflylady

customer_reviews.title: Smelly and expensive
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bedding for 2 years and always seemed the best. Then after a year, the price instantly doubled so I use it SUPER sparingly amongst paper that I shred. It isn't soft like it used to be and now this last bag I got actually smells like poop! I am not sure what happened to this product but I won't buy it again if it keeps smelling like this! It's really awful. So frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: CAC

customer_reviews.title: Not fluffy
customer_reviews.text: We used to use Kaytee Clean & Cozy White Small Animal Bedding but this product has very good reviews so gave a shot. It definitely absorbs urine well and dust-free, but my dwarf hamster does not like it at all. We filled his case half with Kaytee and rest half with this bedding. He doesn't go to this bedding portion unless there was a special treat. He likes fluffy and soft beddings and his favorite spot is my cashmere sweater. Overall, good product but it doesn't work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Hedgehog Approved
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for my hedgehog. Super soft bedding. Zeze loooooves it. He drags it into his sleeping pouch to make it even more cozy in there for him. It absorbs the urine very well. We clean his bedding out every Sunday and can never ever smell the urine. I can spot the #2 waste very easily with the color of the bedding. We like it a lot. It can get everywhere if it gets on bonding blankets or on Zeze himself. But that’s how it is with all bedding. First bedding I have tried and I like it! Great price, too.
customer_reviews.author: The Baumgarners

customer_reviews.title: Changed formula
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this brand until they changed their formula with this new bag design. The new formula have a strange scent to it and is a lot dustier than my previous purchases. My gerbils will come out of their burrow looking like it snowed in their enclosure. The old formula did not do this, held up better to burrowing for my gerbils, and did not have a strange mildew-y smell. I'm probably going to stop by the pet shop and hope they still have some older bags!
customer_reviews.author: undero

customer_reviews.title: Variable quality
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, we have purchased the 60L package from Amazon for several years. It disappeared and this 4-pack option was available. The first time I ordered it, it was four packages of the regular, light colored, compact Carefresh bedding. The second time I ordered it, it was the smelly, dark, granular stuff. I am going to use up what I have, but I will try to order from another supplier in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Cristel

customer_reviews.title: Allergic Reaction + Black Stains
customer_reviews.text: I am having horrendous allergic reactions (wheezing, itching, etc.) to this bedding. I also purchased this same product from Petco in addition to this one from Amazon and had the same reaction. Unsure what happened, but when I had used the same product (purchased from Amazon as well) back in 2017 for my last hamster, I did not have any issues. I am wondering if they had changed the formula in the past 3 years. Additionally, some of the bedding came with gray/black stains.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it. I used it for bunnies and hamsters
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. I used it for bunnies and hamsters, and it woks so much better then woodchips. Takes away the horrible smells that can accompany having a pet. The hamsters love it too. When I clean their cages, they usually just rearrange the chips, then go back to their wheel. When I put this stuff in their cage they played in it for hours. They looked like children playing in snow. The bunny just rolled around in it.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: At PetSmart a 30L is $14 it lasts me about 2 weeks but I got this for $19 double the size. I've had it about a month now and it started stinking, whenever I got it wet with water it smelled really bad (I wash out my rabbits litter box) and whenever she peed on it, just ended up smelling worse. It did the job absorbing it but I bought it because I thought It would do a better job at odor control, guess not. Wont buy again.
customer_reviews.author: tamavisca

customer_reviews.title: Stinks right out of the bag
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened, I used to use Carefresh in my rat cage like 13 years ago, so when I recently got rats again this is what I went for first. However, it smells horrible right from the start, fresh from the bag! It only gets worse as it gets peed/pooped on, and I only have two young female rats in a big cage. Can't even imagine how much it would reek with males, or more rats. Won't be reordering this.
customer_reviews.author: 4Dragons

customer_reviews.title: Quality product with a great price tag!
customer_reviews.text: I use this bedding for my Guinea pigs, as they are sensitive to the wood shavings. The 4 bags will last me for about two weeks and that’s using 1.5 bags at each cage change. It’s not the prettiest of colors, but it does the job! I have searched all over amazon and have compared prices/quantity (cause I’m a cheap ass haha). This deal is by far the BEST deal!! I’m surprised it’s not amazon recommend. I'm so please I just signed up for the monthly automatic orders!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Sammon

customer_reviews.title: We like it!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely absorbent- we don't ever smell our hamster's habitat. She loves burrowing in it and she's buried her entire house in it. We do use an entire package when we change it out so I've bought a large bag of Aspen bedding to try next time- if it's just as good we'll switch due to cost savings. Note- we have s 2 story habitat that's very large and our hamster loves to burrow so we make sure we make it several inches deep for her. You might not need an entire new package for every cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Adah_m

customer_reviews.title: Cat litter supplement for older kitties with urinary issues.
customer_reviews.text: My partner has two cats that are getting up in age and one of them has crystals in her urine. She had taken to urinating on any fabric that was on the floor. We finally figured out that it was because it was a soft material that was more comfortable for her. I remembered Carefresh from when I was keeping small animals and decided we should give it a try. We set up a low litterbox, added a small amount of regular litter and topped it with Carefresh and it worked! Our stuff is saved from the pee monster! I highly recommend this method if you're dealing with a similar problem.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Repage

customer_reviews.title: Hard pellets,not fluff, amazon needs better QC
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and it is rock hard, was not soft. I assumed I had a bad product by mistake, Amazon resent another one out, same issue. Do not waste your money, I bought the blue color. Amazon is holding my refund hostage! I returned this to them and even supplied them with a tracking number from UPS, I contacted Amazon and they said "it might take 2 weeks." I've never had to wait that long for a refund, especially on a damaged/defective product. Terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Fall2007

customer_reviews.title: It's not lint-free enough; their 99% doesn't cut it
customer_reviews.text: This is a very economical option, but I noticed that my daughter's hamster is covered in little lint fibers some of which could probably get into his eyes and cause actual harm. I'm not looking to have to take a hamster to the vet for an eye infection. This really never occurred to me as something I should be considering when buying bedding, but it's a concern now. Even though Kaytee is more expensive, I think it's a better option being that they have 99.9% lint-free bedding.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I subscribed to the 60Lx3 every month and I bought at least 22 times until they changed to the smaller bag 4x14L = 56L with higher price.. So I'm gonna have to manually order the 60L every month now since they don't offer that 60L ($14.99) options in subscription anymore or pay more ($16.99) for less (56L) ~ disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Good absorbancy. Odor killer.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 50L size which is a very large bag. This is the first time I am using this type of bedding vs the shavings I have always been using. I have to say this is more absorbent and I therefore have less odor in my cage. My guinea pig likes to burrow in it more as its more comfortable than shavings. Ultimate question is what's more cost effective. For now, I am switching to this bedding for the next few cycles. The bigger the bag I buy, the cheaper it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jor El

customer_reviews.title: New formulation is horrible
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying this for YEARS for my guinea pigs and they seem to have changed the formula the past couple of months. The bedding in the old packaging is fine, it’s this new kind that stinks. It has zero odor control whatsoever. Five minutes after putting it in the cages I wanted to throw it out. It’s unusable. I’ll be switching to a different brand. Such a shame!
customer_reviews.author: Candi Best

customer_reviews.title: Foul odor coming from shavings this time around.
customer_reviews.text: This is an order subscription and normally I am very happy with the Carefresh quality, value, etc. I have received 3/monthly for some time. This last month, All 3 packages have a very foul smell coming from the paper shavings. It is so bad i can’t use them. I had to purchase a retail order of shavings. If the next batch has the same, I will not be buying again and will have to use something else for our little guys. It smells so bad, and who knows if safe.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product at affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this product. I previously used Carefresh Complete Natural Paper Bedding (50 L) which is a bit more expensive, and I found this product accidentally. This bag is pretty large (60L), and the product is the same quality but more affordable. You have to check the item price regularly as Amazon changes it often, sometimes even every day. I always purchase it as an Add-on item for less than $10.
customer_reviews.author: Marianna

customer_reviews.title: Scent is not good.
customer_reviews.text: The absorbency is great! However, it doesn’t keep the smell away at all. I have one chinchilla and with a different brand I used to have, I would clean the cage once every ten days or even go two weeks and there would be zero smell unless I physically close to the cage. With this bedding, even after even a couple days I can smell the cage when I walk by it. Maybe my chinchilla is just growing and changing and producing more smells. Not sure. But I’ll probably go back to the first brand I used.
customer_reviews.author: Sallyb00

customer_reviews.title: Product changed
customer_reviews.text: Something is wrong with this latest batch. I have ordered the exact same item 3 times. This last one is super dark and smells weird when it gets wet. It’s the color of mud and looks horrible in the hamster cage. The previous packages were tan which was great cause it turned darker when wet. I could just scoop out the wet soiled section. This new package is so dark, you can’t tell when it’s wet. Now I’m scared to buy more online because I don’t like this new version at all!
customer_reviews.author: Linda W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Odor Control
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched to this all-paper bedding from Carefresh's Shavings Plus wood shaving bedding to see if odor control really was better as it advertised. And I have to say it definitely keeps the odors way much longer. With the wood shavings it take about 3 days and our hedgehog cage would start smelling bad. With this paper shaving, the odors stay away for at least 7 days. And I also like that there is no dust like the wood shavings. It is more expensive than the wood shaving bedding, but I think it's worth it for the superior odor control!
customer_reviews.author: Boston Tea

customer_reviews.title: Did not believe the smelly reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Thought people had issues with some bags and thought I would take a chance since usually the poor reviews do not out way the good reviews. Well unfortunately I was burned on this purchase. The smell is HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!! When I say HORRIBLE I mean HORRIBLE. Thought airing it out would work but not so much or not at all. Kept it in garage thru Chicago winter and no luck, still smells HORRIBLE! Very disappointed and will never purchase any product like this from Amazon again. Beware of this product you will not be happy and will have wasted your money$$$$$$$$
customer_reviews.author: DD H

customer_reviews.title: Very soft, hamster loves!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 50L and it is true to size—the package is huge and it will last a long time! This is my favorite bedding to use and my hamster loves it because it’s so soft. By far my favorite brand. I’ve ordered this kind of bedding before in different brands and it comes in clumps where you have to separate it and it’s very time consuming. Not the case with this bedding. Just pour and it’s good to go. The blue is a beautiful bright color!
customer_reviews.author: riley54

customer_reviews.title: I love this for my hedgehog
customer_reviews.text: I love this for my hedgehog. I've been using it for two years and never have an odor issue. Also, unless your idiot dogs are jumping in to play, it won't be all over your house. It compacts in the enclosure yet still able to burrow and make a nest if your pet chooses. Low on dust. To clean the cage I scoop it up with a dust pan and sweep or vacuum up the rest as all moisture is absorbed and unnoticed.
customer_reviews.author: BettyBlue

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: We use this for our 3 guinea pigs. I used to buy it in the pet store for over $20 for the same amount so this is a good deal for me considering how much we go through. We use fleece for the majority of our cage and this goes in their "kitchen" which is basically their litter box. I spot clean in every other day - it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They have changed their product
customer_reviews.text: This will be the second bag I have purchased. I was very pleased with the first, it was a bright white color, like a piece of paper, kept my two dwarf hamsters cage looking and smelling clean for 10+ days (as advertised). The second bag I received today is a very, very dingy white/almost gray color, there seems to be less in the bag and it smells different which leads me to believe they have indeed changed their product. Very disappointed. None the less, I will be keeping because it's a great price for the amount (I got mine for $15). In the future, I will be purchasing somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Momof8

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Bad version of real product
customer_reviews.text: We will not be buying this again. It is not the same as the stuff at the pet store, not the same texture, color or absorbency. Cage smells really bad after just one day. The same care fresh brand at Petco worked much better for masking pet odors. This is hard, and compact with weird shavings of something else besides the paper bedding throughout the bag. Waste of money. Will be spending the few extra bucks to get the good stuff from petco from now on
customer_reviews.author: Ryan E McNeil

customer_reviews.title: I can’t recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: The paper is chunky and hard. I can’t imagine using this hard-as-cardboard wads of paper litter for my rodents who have soft bellies and feet. Imagine laying on a bed of pokey river rock and that’s what I imagine this bedding might feel like for your poor little animals. If you love your pets, look further for a better product. I gave it two stars, rather than one, only because the product does do what the manufacturer says it does. But don’t you want your pet to be comfortable and happy?
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: I Legitimately Love This Stuff
customer_reviews.text: My son has two guinea pigs. We don't try to get 10 days out of this stuff (five is usually the max, since A. one of the pigs is an unstoppable poop machine, and B. they urinate in one corner), but in those five days there is no smell. The pigs seem to like it, and it's easy to clean up when it gets kicked out of their cage. We once let it go seven days (out of town) and were amazed at how little--almost no--odor there was. Very recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MorningGloryRory

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: The reason it's not 5 stars is the natural color pic looks brown, which I love. But it's actually gray. Since this is pricey I buy either America's Best or Golden Fire Douglas fir wood pellets found at Lowes and such places. I only need litter for my guinea pig's kitchen area so I use the wood pellets but put a layer of this over it so it's not so uncomfortable to walk on. The wood pellets are cheap, $7 for a 40lb bag. Works great and saves me money on litter. But for hamsters and other burrowing creatures I wouldn't use wood pellets. Their bedding needs to be soft.
customer_reviews.author: Shonta

customer_reviews.title: Super-Stanky! :(
customer_reviews.text: I order bedding every month for my 3 guinea pigs, and for some reason, this last batch came smelling horrible! Like a damp, dirty wad of old cardboard x50! It also didn’t expand very much. Feels a little more hard than the other paper-based bedding. Also, the colored kinds have never smelled this bad. I won’t order this exact bedding again, perhaps it was just a bad batch, but not worth the risk.
customer_reviews.author: MKski

customer_reviews.title: Best dust free bedding for the rats, plus it's cute!
customer_reviews.text: this is honestly, the best brand I have found of this. It is dust free, only last about 6-7 days before the smell gets too strong, but I have 2 rats so that is normal. Plus the colors that is comes in are super cute. The rats love to play in it. Because it is dust free it is better for their lungs. They sneeze less and are more comfortable. This bedding would work with all type of small caged rodents though. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Snow

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not consistent.
customer_reviews.text: I used to order this product every month. Had to stop auto order because consistency fluctuates. Sometimes they send the great product. Fluffy, extremely absorbent, with a clean look and soft texture. Other times the material seems dirty with a hard texture. Very compressed, no spring or give to the material which makes it harder to absorb. Almost like rejects from the pet store. Have to clean more often. Cleaning every couple of days instead of once to twice a week. But it does come quick, if you cant get to a pet store for the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and inconvenient.
customer_reviews.text: This bedding/stuffing is a very good for small animals. My gerbils love it because it gets puffy the more they play in it. It also is a very nice and attractive color. It’s very good if you have small animals that like to dig and create underground passages. The only thing is that it’s a pain to pick up. The bright blue does not look good al over the floor or in the backyard!
customer_reviews.author: Shane Sokoll

customer_reviews.title: Goes a Long Way plus Really Absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit disappointed when the bedding arrived as the bag didn't look like it could possibly hold 60L but, when opened, it was unbelievable how compressed it was and took an extremely small portion from the bag to totally cover the bottom tray of my large parrot cage! Compared to the paper pellets I'd been using, this bedding not only goes further but is much more absorbent! If I still had guinea pigs, this is definitely what I'd use. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: dinahsgoatmilksoaps

customer_reviews.title: Its ok i would rather buy another though...
customer_reviews.text: So i got this because our notmal carefresh option was out of stock.. for what ever reason we went through this WAY quicker even though it is more. Also i noticed that my guinea pigs have started to sneeze since using this type. My guess would be because this does seem very dusty. Other than those things it did do its job. It helped with the smell and absorbed urine. However again, did not absorb what i expectec from past experiences. I wont buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hamster bedding
customer_reviews.text: My Syrian hamster loves this bedding and so do I. It absorbs odors very well. I highly recommend it. It is a little more expensive but it is well worth it. I love all the different colors too. I’ve had the blue one but currently like the multicolor one.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2KidsDogsHorses

customer_reviews.title: Love the purple color but it's not as soft at the blue bedding.
customer_reviews.text: I like this brand of bedding and ordered the purple because it's my favorite color. However, I noticed it is a bit different then what I usually get. Maybe it's the purple dye, not sure. For some reason this bedding doesn't feel as soft as it usually is. Next time, I am going to order the blue one that I usually order, it's softer and is probably more comfortable for the hamster to burrow under as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia

customer_reviews.title: When you get the appropriate quality, it’s great
customer_reviews.text: I have received inconsistent bedding when ordering from Amazon. Sometimes the color is a light tan and is fluffy. Last time, it was a darker color and was more shedded with tinier pieces. Both get the job done, but more of the darker product is needed to be used. I’m basing my review on what I know the true product to be and not the scraps that seems to come. If you want consistency, pay a little more for shipping and order through Chewy.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin McMahan

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased since we were trying out a new habitat for our Robo dwarf hamster. We wanted to see if she would burrow and we mixed this with some timothy hay. So far she is tolerating it well enough and she has burrowed a bit. We can't wait to see what she will do with the habitat overnight since they are naturally nocturnal. Today she is taking many breaks in between designing her new habitat.
customer_reviews.author: maristar

customer_reviews.title: Updated- Great product! Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Updated: Amazon finally agreed to reship the item they didn’t ship (I received a swimsuit instead of litter). I opted not to call back and went through the automated system. It worked much better than chatting and having to have a phone call. Amazon needs to get it together and put the right shipping labels on the right stuff. Product: I’ve used it before. It works very well for our small critter. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: SouthernRoots

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: risk of respiratory allergy on hamsters!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bedding for the low price. I wish I didn't. The texture is a little bit different than the "regular paper bedding", and has tiny specks of fiber in it. It gave my sweet little hamster a horrible respiratory allergy, a typical reaction from these little guys to pine shavings. My advice: if you have a hamster don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Addastra

customer_reviews.title: Right product wrong color
customer_reviews.text: Not the right color. It shows that it’s a dark color. The white is separate from the dark natural. I ordered the dark natural and white came. I won’t order again I’ll go to the store. Don’t wanna do the hassle of returning so we will just keep. If you want the natural look just watch cause they will deliver the wrong one. Also, it shows darker comes in 30L and white only comes in 23L but they delivered the white in 30L
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: doesn't control odor at all!
customer_reviews.text: The word or name "FRESH" should not be listed anywhere on this item. I've tried at least 5 other brands and they all worked better at keeping the odor under control for at least a few days, but not this brand!!! The cage reeks of odor just a day later after putting all new bedding in it, even after completely sanitizing entire Hamster cage, and then adding baking soda which usually did the trick with other brands. I will NOT buy again or recommend for anyone. Our hamster has been placed in our garage until I buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: LESLIE SALMELA

customer_reviews.title: great value mostly purple
customer_reviews.text: no scent so nice for hedgehog. Only thing my daughter disliked was the fact it was mostly purple. She has a boy hedgehog so she was hoping for more color range and less feminine colors. Other than that it is great and great value
customer_reviews.author: Rachael D Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Staple for small animal cages
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bedding on the market when it comes to the health of your small animals. It has great absorbency and no dust. The trade out is because of the lack of scent, odor control isn't great. Unfortunately the artificial scents or dusty pine aren't great for small mammal respiratory systems so this is really what they need. A little goes a long way. Easy to scoop out for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: HJ

customer_reviews.title: Double thumbs down!  But great if you need gravel!!
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT soft like other brands I've purchased. I had to break hard, large clumps of it down to what basically amounts to hard, smaller clumps. My poor hamster is accustomed to soft and fluffy bedding! This stuff is better suited to use as aquarium gravel and is about as absorbent. Since I don't want an aquarium, I'll keep it in the car to pour behind my tires if I get stuck in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Good other than smell
customer_reviews.text: It has good absorbency, it’s easy to clean, it’s not dusty, the price is decent, and it provides and good home for small animals to nest and burrow. However, as soon as you open the package there’s a strong, unpleasant smell that does not really go away. This is the case with all carefresh I’ve bought, which is the natural type. In addition, the odor control only lasts a few days before your room and then house smells like gerbil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best pet bedding out there
customer_reviews.text: This bedding is GREAT it is highly absorbing and clean smelling. It is also so expansive that you don’t need much at a time and the bag lasts long. I’ve tried a bunch of different types of litter and this one has worked the best. The color enables it to still look clean when in between cleanings, except of course for the most spiked areas, which can be spot cleaned. It doesn’t create a lot of dust and absorbed fluids and orders associated with them, keeping both off the animals.
customer_reviews.author: Kaysyrah

customer_reviews.title: Not good for rabbit litter box
customer_reviews.text: Does not control odor well at all. I have two dwarf lop rabbits and used it for littwr boxes. I had to clean litter boxes twice a day. Impossible to clean. I switched to the Kaytee wood pellets and have not had a problem since. Only have to clean litter boxes 1x a week now! Don't waste money on this if you need it for litter boxes. Use the wood pellets!
customer_reviews.author: FaithAndFamily

customer_reviews.title: cardboard
customer_reviews.text: When I got this product I didnt put it in my mouses cage for a bit. But when I did it felt like straight cut up cardboard. I hope i didnt look soemthing over. My mice are often found laying on top even putting and resting my hand inside the bedding its uncomfortable. I will be getting more bedding softer bedding to add so they have soft stuff to burrow with. Might even remove this crappy stuff completely.
customer_reviews.author: YOLO queen

customer_reviews.title: Bad choice
customer_reviews.text: I was originally ordering the 60L on amazon until it was no longer available. This was a slightly smaller size so I figured I would give it a try. At first it was fine. Same as the 60L and then it changed. The consistency is crumbly. It is darker and it has a bad smell. I immediately went on and ordered a different product. I will not be ordering this again.
customer_reviews.author: April P

product_meta.title: Carefresh Small Pet Bedding
product_meta.description: Size:60 L| Color:NaturalOnly carefresh is made from scratch with pillowy soft, ultra absorbent comfy fluff designed specifically for small pets. Provide a safe and cozy home with carefresh natural. Made from 100% reclaimed natural fiber, it's better for your small pets, your home and the planet. It's the bedding of choice for guinea pigs, rabbits, hamsters, gerbils, rats, mice, and chinchillas.
feature_bullets: 100% made in the USA with High quality material
Designed with your Pets Health and comfort in mind
Dust Free, Safe for all species and types of pet

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
